channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: What's the FCC's role in what stations broadcast?
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with former FCC chairperson Tom Wheeler about ABC pulling Jimmy Kimmel off the air after comments on the right's reaction to the killing of Charlie Kirk.

item.title: This ultramarathoner runs for every Bears loss. The miles are adding up
item.description: In Illinois, a football fan vowed to run a mile for every point the Chicago Bears lose by during a game. Even though he's an ultramarathoner, and a huge Bears fan, the miles are starting to add up.

item.title: Understanding cringe â€” and how it can help or hurt us
item.description: It's Been a Minute's Brittany Luse on the rise of cringe culture: where it comes from, how it's hurting us, and how leaning into cringe is good for art.

item.title: Kimmel's suspension raises free speech questions in the wake of Charlie Kirk's death
item.description: After comedian Jimmy Kimmel's show was suspended "indefinitely" by ABC, questions about free speech in the wake of Charlie Kirk's murder reach a new level.

item.title: This week in science: Mystery dots in space, optical illusions and octopus arms
item.description: The regular Short Wave science roundup covers mysterious red dots in space, the neurons behind optical illusions and a study of octopus arms.

item.title: How Israel's combat medicine has changed
item.description: More Israeli soldiers' lives have been saved in this war compared to previous Gaza wars, due to medical advances, new technology and lessons learned on the operating table.

item.title: Trump says he'll designate antifa a 'terrorist organization,' but it's unclear how
item.description: President Trump has said he wants to see antifa designated a "major terrorist organization." But it's not clear how that might work.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel's suspension shows how the FCC is wielding its power
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with former FCC chairperson Tom Wheeler about ABC pulling Jimmy Kimmel off the air after comments on the right's reaction to the killing of Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Mahmoud Kahlil ordered deported, but there's a long legal fight ahead
item.description: An immigration judge in Louisiana ordered the deportation of pro-Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil to either Algeria or Syria saying he omitted information from a green card application.
